name: Coire Fionnaraich

Foot or cycle access only is permitted from this point to the bothy.  (approx 7.5 Kms)

description: Multi-fuel stove. Greensykes Estate.

name: Green
description: Vehicles should not be brought to the bothy. Wood burning stove.

name: Tunskeen
description: Tunskeen was the first MBA project in 1965. It was rebuilt and enlarged in 1998-99.

name: White Laggan
description: Please note that there is no rubbish collection at this bothy. Please take all of your litter home with you. Wood burning stove. Galloway Forest.

name: Over Phawhope
description: Vehicles must not be taken beyond end of tarmac road up Ettrick Valley. Timber extraction currently in progress in the vicinity of the bothy: please heed advisory signs. Visitors should also be aware that close downstream from the bothy is an SSSI. Please take care not to foul the burn. Wood burning stove. Mountain Bothies Association.

name: Cross Fell (Greg's Hut)
description: Small bothy in popular area, stone floor. No fuel. Multi-fuel stove.

name: Kettleton Byre
description: Hill sheep farm. Please note that nearby pens may be used by shepherds, particularly in the lambing season, April-mid-May. Dogs must be kept under close control at all times. Small stove. Small bothy. Queensberry Estate.

name: Clennoch
description: No fireplace or stove.  Moorbrock Estate.

name: Brattleburn
description: No vehicles beyond public road end at Cloffinburn Cottage, NT 046 066. Please ask at the cottage before parking by Cloffinburn. Access from Cloffinburn Cottage along the Southern Upland Way preferred. Please take note of local signs. Wood burning stove.

name: Tarf Hotel (Feith Uaine)
description: Open fire. No firewood.  There is no vehicular access to Forest Lodge. Please park at car park at foot of Glen Tilt.

name: Burlywhag
description: Hill sheep farm. Please note that the bothy and adjacent pens may be used by shepherds, particularly in the lambing season, April- mid-May. Dogs must be kept under close control at all times. Multi-fuel stove. Queensberry Estate.

name: Shielin of Mark
description: No firewood. Access by way of Glen Lee frowned upon during period 1 September to 20 October. Suggest use alternative route from Loch Muick. Open fire.  Dalhousie Estate.

name: Ryvoan
images: cust_images/bothy images/114 Ryvoan bothy - Simon Jefferies.jpg
description: The estate is an RSPB nature reserve; restrictions may apply at nesting time; contact Reserves Manager, 01479 821409. . Small bothy. Open fire. Abernethy Estate.

name: Gelder Shiel Stable
description: Please liaise with the estate if using the bothy between 1 September and 20 October, Balmoral Estate, 01339 742534. There is a toilet at the bothy, please observe instructions for its use and ensure that it is left clean.   Multifuel stove installed 2015.

name: Faindouran
description: Currently no fire or stove - stove due to be fitted 2016

name: Corrour
description: No fuel in surrounding area. Please do not dig up bogwood. There is a toilet at the bothy, please observe instructions for its use. Multi-fuel stove. Local contact NTS Ranger Service, 01339 741669. Mar Lodge Estate.

name: Charr
description: Glendye Estate. No fire or stove.

name: Ruigh Aiteachain
description: Please contact the estate if using the bothy between 1 September and 20 October. Use only wood supplied, Glenfeshie Estate, 01540 651 212. The toilet is in the adjacent building; please follow instructions for its use and ensure that it is left clean. Wood-burning stove.

name: Callater Stable
description: No open fire or stove.

name: Allt Scheicheachan
description: Fuel scarce. Open fire.  Small bothy.

name: Meanach
description: Deer control: the stag stalking season runs from 15 August to 20 October and the hind cull runs from 21 October to 15 February; before going to the hills during these periods please contact the estate or use

name: Luib Chonnal
description: Deer control: the stag stalking season runs from 15 August to 20 October and the hind cull runs from 21 October to 15 February; before going to the hills during these periods please contact the estate or use Hillphones to find out where deer control is taking place, Braeroy Estate, 01397, 712 587. Fuel scarce, some bogwood. Open fire.

name: Loch Chiarain
description: Deer control: the stag stalking season runs from 15 August to 20 October and the hind cull runs from 21 Oct to 15 February; before going to the hills during these periods please contact Killiechonate and Mamores Estate, 01855 831 337, or use

name: Lairig Leacach
images: cust_images/bothy images/Lairig Leacach & Flint - Ed Brennan.jpg
description: Deer control, the stag stalking season runs from 15 august to 20 October and the hind cull runs from 21 October to 15 February; before going on the hills during these periods please contact the estate or use

name: Gorton
description: Open fire. Not available during stag stalking season without prior permission. Deer control: the stag stalking season runs from 12 August to 20 October and the hind cull runs from 21 October to 15 February; before going on the hills during these periods please contact the estate or use Hillphones to find out where deer control is taking place, Blackmount Estate, 01838 400 255. Fuel scarce.

name: Glenbuck
description: Not available during stag stalking, Sep 15 to Oct 20. Permission should be sought during the hind cull, Oct 21 to Feb 15, 07920 757 737. Open fire. Aberchalder Estate.

name: Culra
description: Deer control: the stag stalking season runs from 15 August to 20 October and the hind cull runs from 21 October to 15 February; before going on the hills during these periods please contact the estate or use Hillphones to find out where deer control is taking place, Ben Alder Estate, 01540 672 000. Fuel scarce, some bogwood.

name: Blackburn of Corrieyairack
description: No off-road vehicles please. Small bothy with one room only. Open fire. Culachy Estate.

name: Mark Cottage
description: Mark Cottage (also known as Mark Ferry) is situated on the Ardgartan peninsula on the shores of Loch Long. Normal access is by forest track from the A83 Arrochar to Inverary Road at Forest Enterprise Information Centre NN 269 037 to a car park at Coilessan Glen NN 258 012 where there is a locked gate and vehicle access prohibited. Foot or cycle access only is permitted from this point to the bothy.  (approx 7.5 Kms)

name: Tomsleibhe
description: Deer control: the stag stalking season runs from 15 August to 20 October and the hind cull from 21 October to 15 February; before going on the hills during these periods please contact Glen Forsa Estate or use Hillphones to find out where deer control is taking place,01680 300229. Open fire.

name: Ben Alder Cottage
description: The stag stalking season runs from 15 August to 20 October and the hind cull runs from 21 October to 15 February; before going on the hills during these periods please contact the estate or use Hillphones to find out where deer control is taking place, Ben Alder Estate, 01540 672 000. Fuel scarce, some bogwood. Multi-fuel stove.

name: Taigh Seumas a' Ghlinne
images: cust_images/bothy images/Tigh seumais a Ghlinne - John Cameron.jpg
description: Please note fire risk to surrounding plantation. Don't light fires outside. Please don't drive on forestry roads. Multi-fuel stove. Lorne Forest.

name: Peanmeanach
description: Deer control: the stag stalking season runs from 15 August to 20 October and the hind cull from 21 October to 15 February; before leaving the path during these periods please comply with notices posted in the vicinity.

name: Resourie
description: Please note fire risk to surrounding plantation. Open fire. Do not light fires outside bothy. Please don't drive on forestry roads. Glenhurich Forest.

name: Glengarrisdale
description: Permission should always be sought from the owner before visiting the bothy, Ardlussa Estate, 01496 820 323. The bothy is not available during stag stalking, mid August to mid October. Driftwood is now scarce. Multi-fuel stove.

name: Essan
description: It is an offence to trespass on the railway line or cross the line except at an approved crossing.

name: Doune Byre
description: Nearby cottage is private. No dogs to be kept at or brought to the bothy. Open fire. Glenfalloch Estate.

name: Leacraithnaich
description: Bothy not available during stag stalking 1 September to 20 October. From then until 15 February access normally restricted to the track from Ardtornish- for alternative route please contact estate office, Ardtornish Estate, 01967 421 292. Dogs must be kept on a lead at all times. Fuel very scarce, do not cut live wood. Open fire. Do not fish in loch without permit from estate.

name: An Cladach
description: Please contact the estate in advance during the stalking season, 20 September to 20 October, Dunlossit Estate, 01496 840 232. Very small bothy. Open fire.

name: Carron
description: No dogs please, especially during the lambing season. Stag stalking in the area south and west of the bothy from end September to end October. The Forestry Commission website states that the forest drive is only open from May to end October. Open fire. Ederline Estate.

name: Strathchailleach
description: Sheep farm, please keep dogs under control.

name: Cadderlie
description: Bothy closed during stalking, 20 September to 20 October. Please keep dogs on lead during the lambing season. Vehicles not permitted beyond entrance to Bonawe quarry. Open fire. Loch Etive Estate.

name: Strathan
description: Sheep farm; please keep dogs under close control. Wood very scarce.  Open fire. Keoldale Estate.

name: Strabeg
description: Not available during stag stalking. Aug 12 to Oct 20. Be careful parking, access to the track is required at all times - any vehicle blocking the entrance will be moved. Please do not damage live wood, there is plenty fallen timber further up the glen. Open fire. Eriboll Estate.

name: Knockdamph
description: Not available during stag stalking, Sep 20 to Oct 20. Open fire. There is no fuel available in the location so please take your own and do not cut live wood. East Rhidorroch Estate.

name: Rowchoish
description: Do not cut live wood. Please help by burning or removing rubbish. Open fire. Do not light fires outside bothy and don't drive on forestry roads. East Lomond Forest.

name: Shenavall
description: Not available during stag stalking, Sep 15 to Oct 20. The MBA has the use of this bothy by courtesy of the local estate. Please co-operate with them by reporting any fishing activity to them. Doing so will be to the mutual benefit of the estate and the MBA. Gruinard Estate. Open fire.

name: Kearvaig
description: The bothy is just outside the firing range, and access through the range is closed when the range is in use, although the bothy can still be used. Firing times are displayed at Durness PO or can be obtained from Major (Retd) Phillip Curtis, Range Officer, 01971 511242 or 07714 722056,

name: Glendhu
description: Estate asks visitors to phone first if intending to visit during stalking season, Aug 12 to Oct 20. Reay Forest Estate, 01971 502220. Open fire.

name: Glencoul
description: Estate asks visitors to phone first if intending to visit during stalking season, Aug 12 to Oct 20. Reay Forest Estate, 01971 502220. Open fire.

name: The Schoolhouse
description: No stove or fireplace. Not available during stalking, September 1 to October 20. Corriemulzie Estate.

name: Coiremor
description: Not available during stag stalking, Sep 1 to Oct 20. Multi-fuel stove. Corriemulzie Estate.

name: A'Chuil
description: No restrictions on access but please consult estate notices about low level routes during the stalking season. Open fire. Earl of Mexborough.

name: Achnanclach
description: Not available during stag stalking, Sep 10 to Oct 20. Please give priority to shepherds who use the bothy occasionally. Sheep farm, please keep dogs under control. Open fire. Syre Estate.

name: Croft House
description: Open fire. Strathy South Estate.
